headerDisplay:
[homebridge-myq2](https://github.com/hjdhjd/homebridge-myq2) is a Homebridge plugin to interact with myQ Smart Garage door openers, made primarily by LiftMaster and Chamberlain.

See the [Feature Options](https://github.com/hjdhjd/homebridge-myq2#feature-options) section in the documentation for a complete list of features that can be enabled or disabled.
footerDisplay: For additional help please see the [homebridge-myq2](https://github.com/hjdhjd/homebridge-myq2) Github page.

activeRefreshDuration.title: Active Refresh Duration
activeRefreshDuration.description: Duration in seconds to use the Active Refresh Interval. Default: 300

activeRefreshInterval.title: Active Refresh Interval
activeRefreshInterval.description: Refresh interval in seconds to use when the device state changes are detected. Default: 3

appId.title: myQ Application Identifier
appId.description:
Override the builtin myQ application identifier when connecting to the myQ API. This setting is only useful when myQ API changes occur and this plugin hasn't been updated.
Changing this setting without understanding the implications will result in being unable to connect to the myQ API and potentially being denylisted from the myQ API servers.Use with extreme care.

Default: none (builtin)

debug.title: Debug Logging
debug.description: Logging verbosity for debugging purporses. Default: false

email.title: myQ Username
email.description: Email address used for your myQ account.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name you would like to assign to this myQ Home Bridge. Default: myQ2

password.title: myQ Password
password.description: Password used for your myQ account.

refreshInterval.title: Refresh Interval
refreshInterval.description: Normal refresh interval of myQ device status from the myQ API in seconds. Default: 12

layout.title: Advanced Settings (Optional)
layout.help: Configure advanced features such as debugging.

items.description:
Available options (one option per entry):
  • Hide.serialnumber to hide the gateway (and all associated openers) or individual opener from being shown in HomeKit.
  • Show.serialnumber to force a gateway (and all associated openers) or opener to be shown in HomeKit.

Click here for Feature Options documentation
